title: Four Chaplin shorts from 1917: The Adventurer, The Cure, Easy Street and The Immigrant

sources.title: Four Chaplin shorts from 1917: The Adventurer, The Cure, Easy Street and The Immigrant
sources.description:
Chaplin’s self-curated 1941 anthology revitalizes four 1917 films with new audio, tracing his Tramp’s law-dodging escapes, spa-induced chaos, slum taming, and immigrant grit to showcase his comedic evolution and enduring legacy.. Charlie's obsession with perfection, even in the most ordinary scenes, often exasperated his fellow artists.

Directed and Written by Charlie Chaplin

Main cast:
Charles Chaplin
Edna Purviance
Eric Campbell
Albert Austin
Lloyd Bacon
Henry Bergman
Kitty Bradbury
Frank J. Coleman

Black & White version: https://youtu.be/N9lDRiNJz3k

00:31  The Immigrant - Chaplin’s penniless immigrant survives a stormy Atlantic crossing, outsmarts a thuggish waiter with a rigged coin, and impulsively drags his love interest into marriage after a restaurant showdown.
20:27  The Adventurer - Chaplin's escaped convict dodges police through cliffside chases, rescues a drowning socialite, and wreaks havoc at a lavish party while evading capture.
39:21  The Cure - A boozy Chaplin smuggles liquor into a health spa, triggers chaotic brawls with a gout-stricken rival, and unintentionally spikes the spa’s water supply, turning patients into drunken revelers.
58:31  Easy Street - Chaplin’s reformed tramp-turned-cop outwits a hulking bully using a gas-powered lamppost trap, drops a stove on his head, and transforms a violent slum into a orderly haven.
